metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14767 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sdp_parse_fmtp_config_h264 function in libavformat/rtpdec_h264.c in FFmpeg before 3.3.4 mishandles empty sprop-parameter-sets values, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted sdp file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4-1').
